body: \text{Find the rate of change of the area of a circle with respect to its radius } r \text{ when } r = 6 \text{ cm.}
\text{The volume of a cube is increasing at the rate of } 9 \text{ cm}^3/\text{s. How fast is the surface area increasing when the edge length is } 10 \text{ cm?}
\text{The radius of a circle is increasing uniformly at the rate of } 3 \text{ cm/s. Find the rate at which the area of the circle is increasing when the radius is } 10 \text{ cm.}

\text{A stone is dropped into a quiet lake and waves move in circles at a speed of } 5 \text{ cm/s. At the instant when the radius of the circular wave is } 8 \text{ cm, how fast is the enclosed area increasing?}
\text{Find the maximum area of an isosceles triangle inscribed in the ellipse } \frac{x^2}{a^2} + \frac{y^2}{b^2} = 1 \text{ with its vertex at one end of the major axis.}

\text{A window is in the form of a rectangle surmounted by a semicircular opening. The total perimeter of the window is } 10 \text{ m. Find the dimensions of the window to admit maximum light through the opening.}

\text{A ladder 5 m long is leaning against a wall. The bottom of the ladder is pulled along the ground, away from the wall, at the rate of } 2 \text{ cm/s. How fast is its height on the wall decreasing when the foot of the ladder is 4 m away from the wall?}
\text{Prove that the height of the cylinder of maximum volume that can be inscribed in a sphere of radius } R \text{ is } \frac{2R}{3}. \text{ Also, find the maximum volume.}
\text{Show that the function given by } f(x) = \frac{\ln x}{x} \text{ has a maximum at } x = e.
\text{The radius of an air bubble is increasing at the rate of } \frac{1}{2} \text{ cm/s. At what rate is the volume of the bubble increasing when the radius is } 1 \text{ cm?}
\text{Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of the function } f(x) = \cos^2 x + \sin x, \text{ for } x \in [0, \pi].

\text{A balloon, which always remains spherical, is being inflated by pumping in 900 cm}^3 \text{ of gas per second. Find the rate at which the radius of the balloon increases when the radius is } 15 \text{ cm.}

\text{The sum of the perimeter of a circle and a square is } k, \text{ where } k \text{ is a constant. Prove that the sum of their areas is least when the side of the square is double the radius of the circle.}

\text{The length of a rectangle is decreasing at the rate of 5 cm/minute, and the width is increasing at the rate of 4 cm/minute. When the length is 8 cm and width is 6 cm, find the rates of change of (a) the perimeter, and (b) the area of the rectangle.}

\text{A point on the hypotenuse of a triangle is at distance } a \text{ and } b \text{ from the sides of the triangle. Show that the minimum length of the hypotenuse is } \frac{\sqrt{a^2 + b^2}}{\sqrt{3}}.
\text{Let } f(x) = x^3 - 3x + 3. \text{ Find all points of local maxima and minima.}
\text{Find the maximum area of a triangle that can be inscribed in a circle of radius } R.

\text{A conical tank has a radius of 3 m and a height of 9 m. Water is being poured into the tank at a rate of 5 m}^3\text{/min. Find the rate at which the water level is rising when the water is 4 m deep.}
\text{Let } f(x) = x^4 - 8x^2 + 16. \text{ Determine the intervals on which the function is increasing and decreasing.}
\text{Find the maximum and minimum values of } f(x) = x - \ln x \text{ for } x > 0.
\text{Prove that the function } f(x) = e^x - x \text{ is increasing on } \mathbb{R}.
\text{Show that the function given by } f(x) = x^2 e^{-x} \text{ is increasing on } (0, \infty).
\text{Find the point on the curve } y = \sqrt{x} \text{ at which the tangent is inclined at } 45^\circ \text{ to the } x\text{-axis.}
\text{The cost of producing } x \text{ items is } C(x) = x^2 + 100x + 500. \text{ Find the production level that minimizes the average cost.}
\text{Prove that the function } f(x) = \ln x - \frac{1}{x} \text{ is increasing for } x > 1.
\text{Show that the radius of the cylinder of maximum volume that can be inscribed in a cone of height } h \text{ and base radius } R \text{ is } \frac{2R}{3}.
\text{If the radius of a circular plate increases at a constant rate of } 0.1 \text{ cm/s, at what rate is the area increasing when the radius is 5 cm?}
\text{Find the maximum profit if the cost and revenue functions are } C(x) = 500 + 20x \text{ and } R(x) = 120x - 0.5x^2, \text{ respectively.}
\text{A cylindrical tank with a radius of 10 m is being filled with water at the rate of } 314 \text{ m}^3\text{/hour. Find the rate at which the water level is rising.}
